attachments.text: If it refers to getting the names of the installed packages in alphabetical order without using the deprecated package, then you can use something like julia> io = IOBuffer(); julia> using Pkg; Pkg.status(; io) julia> text = String(take!(io)); julia> lines = split(text, '\n')[2:end-1] 5-element Array{SubString{String},1}: " [336ed68f] CSV v0.8.2" " [a93c6f00] DataFrames v0.22.2" " [59287772] Formatting v0.4.2" " [713c75ef] Franklin v0.10.21" " [38e38edf] GLM v1.3.11" julia> lines_...

text: The Manifest.toml includes all the relevant information from Pkg.status. All the packages installed _in your current environment_, and its dependencies are in the Manifest.toml. For the reproduction of the environment you just need to pass the Manifest,toml and do `pkg> activate .`  and `pkg> instantiate` .
